name: Quotes from '18th and Potomac' Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: "I believe this operation is no longer covert."
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	The President was referring to the large group of people that knew about the President not disclosing his MS to the public. He made this quote after mentioning Joey's interpreter Kenny and no one knowing his last name. Joey told the President to trust him and the President looked to Josh before accepting what Joey said about Kenny's trustworthiness.

questions.text: "You think without the Seal, people are gonna forget he's the President?"
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	When Sam made this quote, he and CJ were talking about where the President and First Lady would be when the interview would be held when he would disclose his MS and the fact that he hid it until now.

Josh.

	Charlie, Josh, and Mrs. Landingham were discussing Mrs. Landingham buying a new car. When Josh asked her if she got the service warranty and she said no, he uttered, "Women".

questions.text: Abbey to ______: "When did I stop being "Dr." Bartlet? When in the campaign did I decide that women were gonna like me more if I called myself "Mrs."? When did I decide that women were that stupid?"
questions.explanation:
Oliver.

	Abbey had just walked into Oliver's office when he addressed Abbey by "Mrs.". Abbey gave him this quote and then Oliver addressed her as "Doctor" and told her the reason he called her to his office was to tell her that she needed to get her own lawyer. He would give her eight names and she would choose three and then Oliver would pick one of the lawyers out of the three names.

Toby.

	Toby says this to Leo when Leo walks into his own office. He is talking about the whole mess with the President's undisclosed illness and how they don't even know if the President will want to go on for a second term. He told Leo they need to have a discussion about whether the President will want a second term and Leo agrees that they will have a discussion and it will be that night.

questions.text: "Why do men think women can't buy a car without a man?"
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Landingham

	Charlie told Josh that Mrs. Landingham was getting a brand new car. Mrs. Landingham asked why men think women couldn't buy cars without them and Josh said it was an old stereotype.

questions.text: "It's an expression, Fannie Mae! Go get your car!"
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	The President told Mrs. Landingham to bring her car back to the White House when she picks it up because he wants to kick the tires. Mrs. Landingham doesn't understand why he wants to do that and the President explains that it's an expression. President Bartlet was going to tell Mrs. Landingham about his MS.

Sam.

	Sam and Abbey were in the basement discussing when the President started showing symptoms. Abbey was using medical jargon to explain all his symptoms and, with a smile on his face, Sam told her she had a dumb major.

questions.text: "The American people deserve their day in court."
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	Leo finally gave Josh the go ahead to let the Justice Department go after the tobacco company with everything they had including backup from Congress. They were going to start with CJ making a strong statement about the lawsuit in her press briefing.

questions.text: "Leo, there was an accident at 18th and Potomac."
questions.explanation:
Charlie.

	After Charlie told Leo that Mrs. Landingham had died, Leo went to tell the President who was alone in his office. Leo informing the President that Mrs. Landingham had died was not heard, but both men were seen talking through the portico door that entered into the Oval Office.
